content.text:
# European interwar dictatorships

This is a list of dictatorial regimes operational in European states in the interwar period, the period between World War I and World War II.

See also
* Interwar period
* Dictatorship
Footnotes
Further reading
* Gerhard Besier, Katarzyna Stokłosa, European Dictatorships: A Comparative History of the Twentieth Century, Cambridge, 2014,
* Carles Boix, Michael K. Miller, Sebastian Rosato (December 2013), [https://www.princeton.edu/~cboix/Boix_Miller_Rosato%20--%20Final_CPS.pdf "A Complete Dataset of Political Regimes, 1800–2007"], Comparative Political Studies 46/12, pp. [https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/abs/10.1177/0010414012463905 1523–1554]
* Stephen J. Lee, European Dictatorships, 1918–1945, London, 2002,
* Monty G. Marshall, Ted Gurr, Keith Jaggers, [http://www.systemicpeace.org/inscr/p4manualv2016.pdf The Polity IV Project: Political Regime Characteristics and Transitions, 1800–2012 – Dataset Users' Manual], s.l. 2017
* Jørgen Møller, Svend-Erik Skaaning, [https://ecpr.eu/Events/Event/PaperDetails/15975 "Mapping Political Regime Developments in Interwar Europe: A Multidimensional Approach"], Salamanca, 2014 (paper delivered at ECPR session)
External links
